programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Rugged Road Home
programme.desc: Marty embarks on a dangerous self-shot mission to carve a road up 300-ft cliffs. Meanwhile, Misty enlists her family to build a predator-proof coop for the chickens

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri helps prepare the zoos new baby rhino for a life-saving vaccine. Robert is on a rescue mission to save two black swans in bad shape

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Documentary following Texas game wardens as they fight crime and protect natural resources. In South Texas, a warden assists in releasing cold-stunned sea turtles back into the sea. A standard patrol at a fishing spot leads to a drugs bust and a manhunt

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeffs team races to help a tiny dog to deliver a large puppy and save both lives. The vets also head downtown to help homeless people and their pets

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and the team head to Mexico to offer free veterinary care for poor families. Over one gruelling week they treat hundreds of animals in need

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: After the great flood of 2016 devastates Louisiana, Tia and the team help the victims. An elderly woman is put in hospital and separated from her dogs

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia attempts to rescue a stray, but her leg injury holds her back, and new parolee Mike struggles to balance working and parenthood

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Soil poisoned by coal production hampers a Kentucky homestead. The Raneys must build a hillside garden on the only unpolluted land and find a source of clean water

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Flood, Sweat and Tears - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A dangerous request from the Smith family in a Missouri flood zone forces the Raneys to build a dam and plan an entire cabin move

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson designs a beehive-style structure for couple Donald and Alison Farmer. The small space includes shelving, soft seating and hexagonal, honeycomb-inspired features

programme.title: Meet the Penguins
programme.desc: The staff of Sancob Seabird Rescue Centre in Cape Town try to help a penguin contaminated by oil. Wannabe dad Winston takes his nest-building too far

programme.title: Meet the Penguins
programme.desc: Crabby, the centres grumpiest resident, greets a new arrival that melts his icy heart, and Princess - queen of the resident penguins - faces the biggest loss of her young life

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Answers to more fun animal questions, such as how a squirrel is able to take on a dangerous rattlesnake, what makes eagles eyes so powerful and why the planet is overrun with bugs

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Animal questions answered, including why pandas are black and white, whether parrots know what they are talking about and how electric eels manage to not electrocute themselves

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: In the Madagascan rainforest, the team searches for a nearly invisible creature, the panther chameleon. When testing, the reptile seems to defy the laws of physics

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy discover that the Yucatan thorn forest is the ideal home for the tough spiny-tailed iguana, but a perilous place for thin-skinned humans

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: An endangered Chinese alligator shows signs of being pregnant. Staff prepare to release rare New England cottontail rabbits into the wild

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde meets basketball star Shaquille ONeal, who requests an aquarium built inside the front end of a semi-truck

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto, Jane and Shane transport a cabin to the distant and uninhabited Perl Island - but things take a sinister turn when they discover a predator is on the loose

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: The intrepid anglers are in Borneo searching for the mahseer - a fish close to extinction. To find it, they risk entering the territory of the headhunting Dayak people

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: Dan travels to Chicago to give cockfighting roosters a second chance. The crew members worry whether an unruly cow will be welcomed by the rest of the herd

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: With a huge storm predicted, the siblings rush to complete a project to capture and store water. Meanwhile, Gabe prepares for his wedding with a surprise bachelor party

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Future of the Forty
programme.desc: Spring arrives and the family self-shoots preparation for the epic expansion of their homestead. Misty plots a huge greenhouse to feed three generations

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: As summer arrives, the team hosts a car wash to raise money for cows and donkeys. Dan goes on a covert mission to save an injured goat

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Former Charmed actress Alyssa Milano asks the duo to build an elegant aquarium complete with a built-in wine rack for her family

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen and Debbie Michielson rescue dogs on the brink of turning feral from their dead owners property

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen faces the difficult task of seizing an ill-tempered pot-bellied pig

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert takes part in a research experiment involving a Komodo dragon, while Terri does her best to save a koala that has been given little prospect of survival

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tania heads to California to pick up a former Villalobos Rescue Centre dog whose adopter has died. A badly injured puppy is discovered to be a missing pet

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys create their first-ever self-automated homestead in the fierce Alaskan wilderness, while firefighters Kim and Casey Boespflug are away on duty

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Marty embarks on an ambitious, off-grid hydropower system following a storm. Meanwhile, a unexpected accident leads to a construction site injury

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: In Galveston County, a game warden needs to find a home for an alligator. The wardens in Hunt County investigate a family property damaged by bullets

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff performs a risky operation to save a puppys leg - but whether the pooch will walk again is another matter. Plus, an abandoned cats x-ray tells a shocking story

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson creates a climbers haven for an arboreal couple whose love of trees rivals his own. The design features 17ft high ceilings and open-frame timber rafters

programme.title: Alaska Monsters
programme.desc: A team of outdoorsmen takes on the challenge of exploring the Alaska Triangle to uncover proof of the cryptic creatures thought to be living there

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: The Kilchers put their own, distinctive spin on the traditional Secret Santa gift exchange, preparing hand-made tools for their relatives - including a crossbow and explosives

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: When an ostrich lays its first egg, the Brown siblings rush to work out how to incubate it. Meanwhile, Bear gets a special visit from a girl on North Star Ranch

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tania heads to California to pick up a former Villalobos Rescue Centre dog whose adopter has died. A badly injured puppy is discovered to be a missing pet

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert takes part in a research experiment involving a Komodo dragon, while Terri does her best to save a koala that has been given little prospect of survival

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: Following residents in the Frank Church Wilderness in Idaho. As the winter ice thaws, people living on the bank are forced to navigate the spring rapids

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson creates a climbers haven for an arboreal couple whose love of trees rivals his own. The design features 17ft high ceilings and open-frame timber rafters

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen and Debbie Michielson rescue dogs on the brink of turning feral from their dead owners property

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Sea Devils
programme.desc: Re-edited feature-length version of the 1972 six-part adventure in which the Time Lord encounters marine monsters who he believes are responsible for a succession of missing ships, but he is not the only one interested in the mysterious creatures. Starring Jon Pertwee, with Katy Manning and Roger Delgado

programme.title: Sammy Davis Jr at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of the singer, actor and dancers finest moments on British TV, showing off his unbeatable talents as an entertainer and opening up about his life in several fascinating conversations with the likes of Michael Parkinson and Terry Wogan. He discusses his encounters with racism and his relationship with Americas civil rights movement, the breakdown of his marriage to actress May Britt, and the car accident that cost him an eye. Alongside the insights into his life and experiences are archive performances of Once In a Lifetime, Me and My Shadow and My Funny Valentine

programme.title: An Evening with Sammy Davis Jr
programme.desc: A compilation of the singer, actor and dancers performances for the BBC that were filmed in the 1960s, featuring classic songs including My Funny Valentine and Once in a Lifetime. The entertainer demonstrates his impersonations of well-known stars of the era, with cameras capturing him also being quick on the draw with a pistol

programme.title: Life of a Mountain: A Year on Blencathra
programme.desc: Award-winning film-maker Terry Abraham returns to the Lake District to showcase the peoples mountain - Blencathra, looking at the lives of local residents, schoolchildren and tourists. Featuring contributions from comedian Ed Byrne, broadcaster Stuart Maconie, mountaineer Alan Hinkes OBE and record-breaking fell runner Steve Birkinshaw

programme.title: Woolly Mammoth: Secrets from the Ice
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the natural history of the ice age mammals that once roamed across what is now Europe and Asia. Detailed information about their lives has been gleaned from carcasses preserved in the Siberian permafrost, and the anatomist meets scientists using genetic, chemical and molecular tests to reveal the adaptations that allowed mammoths to evolve from tropical animals to creatures capable of surviving extreme cold

programme.title: The Truth About Christmas Carols
programme.desc: Composer Howard Goodall uncovers the often turbulent and uncomfortable relationship between carols and the celebration of Christmas. Though around since the 12th century, the hymns have only been a feature of services for the past 150 years, as the Church believed them to be pagan or of no value. They have been used as secret codes, saved from the brink of extinction and subject to state censorship. The programme includes performances by folk star Bella Hardy, the Purbeck Village Choir and the Truro Cathedral Choir, who recreate the very first Service of Nine Lessons and Carols

programme.title: Sammy Davis Jr at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of the singer, actor and dancers finest moments on British TV, showing off his unbeatable talents as an entertainer and opening up about his life in several fascinating conversations with the likes of Michael Parkinson and Terry Wogan. He discusses his encounters with racism and his relationship with Americas civil rights movement, the breakdown of his marriage to actress May Britt, and the car accident that cost him an eye. Alongside the insights into his life and experiences are archive performances of Once In a Lifetime, Me and My Shadow and My Funny Valentine

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Sea Devils
programme.desc: Re-edited feature-length version of the 1972 six-part adventure in which the Time Lord encounters marine monsters who he believes are responsible for a succession of missing ships, but he is not the only one interested in the mysterious creatures. Starring Jon Pertwee, with Katy Manning and Roger Delgado

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Celebrities explore landscapes in Yorkshire and Cumbria. The Rev Richard Coles walks through the North York Moors and along the Sutton Bank. His journey takes him to the ruins of Rievaulx Abbey, once one of Englands most powerful Cistercian monasteries. where he reflects on the need for silent contemplation

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Amanda Owen crosses hills and fields through Wensleydale and Raydale, taking ancient routes first made by the Romans and exchanging notes with fellow sheep farmers. Crossing over the dale, she drops down to Semer Water, ending her walk on the pebble banks

programme.title: Natures Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores unusual and unexplained natural events that occur around the world during winter, enlisting the aid of leading scientists to uncover why these strange events happen. The programme examines unusual weather conditions, including tornadoes made of snow, and animals behaving in unexpected ways, from snowboarding crows to penguins attempting death-defying feats

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of the Mona Lisa
programme.desc: Alan Yentob tells the story of how Leonardo Da Vincis Mona Lisa became the most famous painting in the world. Admired by six million tourists every year, surrounded by bodyguards and encased in a humidified, air-conditioned box protected by bullet-proof glass, the enigmatic masterpiece has been stolen, vandalised and exploited over the centuries. With the help of leading scholars and original research, the subject of the portrait is finally revealed - along with the reason behind her inscrutable smile

programme.title: Britains Pompeii: A Village Lost in Time
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts joins the team excavating a 3,000-year-old Bronze Age village in the Cambridgeshire Fens that burned to the ground and was preserved in peat. Archaeologists also investigate the cause of the fire. Was it just a terrible accident, or did the villagers wealth provoke an attack?

programme.title: On Camera: Photographers at the BBC
programme.desc: The working practices, lives and opinions of some of the greatest photographers of the last 60 years, drawn from the BBCs archives. The programme brings into focus the key genres - fashion, portraiture, documentary and landscape - and the characters behind the camera who have helped defined them, including Norman Parkinson, David Bailey, Eve Arnold and Martin Parr

programme.title: The Magical World of Julia Donaldson
programme.desc: Celebration of the life and work of the bestselling childrens author, with animated sequences by long-term illustrator Axel Scheffler bringing her story to life. The film reveals the surprising stories behind iconic characters like the Gruffalo, Zog and Stick Man, and explores how her simple but poignant handling of themes of love, loss, fear and tyranny appeal to children and adults alike. Narrated by Julie Walters, and featuring readings from Donaldsons books by Helena Bonham Carter, Imelda Staunton and James McAvoy

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Celebrities explore landscapes in Yorkshire and Cumbria. The Rev Richard Coles walks through the North York Moors and along the Sutton Bank. His journey takes him to the ruins of Rievaulx Abbey, once one of Englands most powerful Cistercian monasteries. where he reflects on the need for silent contemplation

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Amanda Owen crosses hills and fields through Wensleydale and Raydale, taking ancient routes first made by the Romans and exchanging notes with fellow sheep farmers. Crossing over the dale, she drops down to Semer Water, ending her walk on the pebble banks

programme.title: Woolly Mammoth: Secrets from the Ice
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the natural history of the ice age mammals that once roamed across what is now Europe and Asia. Detailed information about their lives has been gleaned from carcasses preserved in the Siberian permafrost, and the anatomist meets scientists using genetic, chemical and molecular tests to reveal the adaptations that allowed mammoths to evolve from tropical animals to creatures capable of surviving extreme cold

programme.title: Natures Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham explores unusual and unexplained natural events that occur around the world during winter, enlisting the aid of leading scientists to uncover why these strange events happen. The programme examines unusual weather conditions, including tornadoes made of snow, and animals behaving in unexpected ways, from snowboarding crows to penguins attempting death-defying feats

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Arsenal at Villa Park and Manchester City v Sunderland at Etihad Stadium. The Gunners were looking to emulate their 2-0 win over the Villans here last term, while their fellow title challengers City hosted a Sunderland side that had impressed in the top flight since their Championship play-off triumph last term. Plus, Bournemouth v Chelsea, Everton v Nottingham Forest, Newcastle United v Burnley, Tottenham Hotspur v Brentford and Leeds United v Liverpool

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers looks at the political developments of the week and questions policy makers on the key issues

programme.title: My Life at Christmas with Anita Rani
programme.desc: Anita strikes up an in-depth conversation with rock star Rod Stewart and his wife, broadcaster Penny Lancaster, discovering what makes Christmas special for them, and how its been a marker for memorable moments in their careers, family life and faith

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.sub-title: Shree Hindu Temple and Community Centre, Leicester
programme.desc: A prayer service from the Shree Hindu Temple in Leicester. Each days service is devoted to a different deity, with todays celebrating Lord Shiva. To bring about a spiritual connection and create an uplifting atmosphere, bhajans, or hymns, are led by groups of musicians and congregants

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: On the second Sunday of Advent, Claire McCollum continues a series unpacking the themes of the season with a visit to Coventry Cathedral to explore what peace means

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the opening session of the final from York Barbican, where eight frames are scheduled to be played. Judd Trump held a 5-3 lead over Barry Hawkins at the end of last years corresponding session. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson travels around the Lothians with a buyer from Edinburgh who has a £360,000 budget to make a much-longed-for break from the city - and has brought her aunt along for support

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn are in Bannau Brycheiniog National Park, where the power of water that runs through its valleys shapes the landscape both above and below ground. Matt joins a local caving team, while Sammi visits a 200-year-old mill still driven by the force of the water. Plus, Adam Henson is in Lincolnshire, where a farmer is taking a gamble on growing olives

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team explore the history of food through objects that reveal 400 years of cooking and eating, from farmhouse fare to royal banquets. Guests including Mary Berry, food historian Ivan Day, restaurateur Ronnie Archer Morgan and author and broadcaster Dr Annie Gray share culinary items with a history, while a visit to Ulster Folk Museum in Belfast reveals the history of soda bread

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: The lion pride have grown stronger than ever, and the wild dogs have dwindled. Leopard Mutima returns home, while her ageing mother Olimba must overcome injury if she is to succeed in one final challenge. A new hyena queen rises from chaos, but can she regain ground from the lions? Even the powerful lion pride are under threat, especially when crossing Nsefus crocodile-ridden waters

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman reveal which two celebrities have to compete in the penultimate dance-off, knowing one of them wont be making it through to next weeks semi-final. The professionals present a routine to a classic number from Chicago, and the cast of hit comedy musical Titanique perform in the ballroom

programme.title: The War Between the Land and the Sea
programme.desc: Doctor Who spin-off, about a conflict between the human race and an ancient species of aquatic reptiles. An ordinary man finds himself caught in the conflict as the Thames reveals some terrifying secrets. Starring Russell Tovey and Gugu Mbatha-Raw, with Jemma Redgrave reprising her Doctor Who role as UNIT leader Kate Lethbridge-Stewart

programme.title: The War Between the Land and the Sea
programme.desc: Barclay becomes humanitys ambassador when the mysterious Salt emerges from the Tank. But his familys life is torn apart when Salt wreaks revenge upon all mankind. Doctor Who spin-off about a conflict between the human race and an ancient species of aquatic reptiles. Starring Russell Tovey and Gugu Mbatha-Raw

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Brighton and Hove Albion v West Ham United at Amex Stadium and Fulham v Crystal Palace at Craven Cottage. Brighton claimed a dramatic 3-2 victory over the Hammers in last seasons corresponding fixture thanks to late goals by Kaoru Mitoma and Carlos Baleba. Palace defeated the Cottagers away from home in both the league and their victorious FA Cup campaign in 2024/25

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends matches in the Super League, including Arsenal v Liverpool, Manchester United v West Ham United and Chelsea v Everton

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Comedian Alan Carr joins the host to discuss his recent projects, including his victory in Celebrity Traitors. Also appearing are Oscar-winner Kate Winslet, who discusses her role as first-time director of Christmas movie Goodbye June, former New Zealand politician Jacinda Ardern, whose documentary film Prime Minister tells the story of her five-year tenure at the top and US talk show host and podcaster Seth Meyers. Plus, Carrs fellow Traitor Cat Burns performs Theres Just Something About Her, from her album How to Be Human

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble go behind the scenes at Longleat House and Safari Park once more. The keepers work hard to get the animals ready for winter, and also introduce new residents, including binturongs, dik-diks and ostriches

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Tommy Walsh and Jacqui Joseph meet the new owners of a house in Hednesford, Staffordshire and two retail spaces in Norwich and Weymouth to hear about their development plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents a show from the Scottish Borders, and learns about the history of salmon fishing. Irita Marriott and David Harper help the teams at an antiques fair in Kelso

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: A Glaswegian grandmothers childhood kitchen is lovingly rebuilt in miniature to help her reconnect with the tenement home - and the grandparents - she lost too soon. With no photos and only scraps of memory to guide her, miniaturist Abi faces one of her toughest builds yet

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Leatherworker Dani from Preston and calligraphy artist Masooma from London turn to Dom Chinea and his team of experts for help turning their hobbies into businesses. Theatre worker Dani fell in love with leather work three years ago but mentor Andy thinks she needs to celebrate the heritage of her craft and improve her techniques before taking her goods to market. Former finance worker Masooma moved from the middle east two years ago and needs some help reaching UK markets but mentor Claudia thinks shes not approaching the right locations and isnt charging enough

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse is in the Carmarthenshire countryside, showing a retired couple from Jersey some special homes, including one which comes complete with some beavers in the backyard. Along the way, Denise meets a couple who escaped to the county to open a tea shop

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Two-Faced Baby Soap, Garden Festival Glasses, Coconut Shy Box
programme.desc: The dealers come face to face with their creepiest item yet and enjoy all the fun of the fair. Plus, 10-year-old Cassie tries to pull their strings with her vintage puppets

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Roo Irvine go on an adventure around South Yorkshire, where they discover a 17th-century road map of Scotland and an art nouveau mirror

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: A High Court judge presiding over an organised crime case is badly injured after a fall, but witnesses report he argued with someone beforehand. As Luke issues Eve with an ultimatum, Clint struggles to keep the truth from Nicole. Marlene confronts Sasha about her secret relationship with Donal, and is offered a deal in return for backing off. Lois fears she has ruined her relationship with Seamie

programme.title: If Walls Could Talk
programme.desc: Larne Museum and Arts Centre, once a Carnegie Free Library, has now become the guardian of the towns heritage. Locals share memories of its library days and its transformation into a museum, which was led by local visionary John Clifford - a man with a passion for preserving the history of ordinary lives in extraordinary ways

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam Mitchell is back in Walford, and it doesnt take her long to cause trouble as she heads to No.55 to steal money from Phils safe. Jack makes a shocking discovery, Nicola tries her best to protect Harry, and Kat grows even more concerned for Zoe

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Richard Bilton reports on the rising number of potholes across the UK, and why many councils are struggling to stay on top of the problem. He talks to frustrated residents campaigning to get their roads fixed, insiders who reveal what they think is going wrong, people whove been hurt by potholes, and those who run and maintain the road network

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants head back to medieval times in the semi-finals, preparing a banquet for 80 guests at Coombe Abbey, a former 12th-century monastery in rural Warwickshire. On their return to the MasterChef kitchen, they are challenged to impress the judges with a pie of their choice, before two are chosen to leave the contest

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: A Bump Along the Way
programme.desc: A 44-year-old single mother becomes pregnant from a one-night-stand, much to the shame of her buttoned-up teenage daughter. Director Shelly Loves comedy drama, starring Bronagh Gallagher, Lola Petticrew and Mary Moulds

programme.title: Shortscreen
programme.desc: Black comedy short following the story a dog who is accused of anti-social behaviour, directed by Adam Patterson and Declan Lawn

programme.title: Matthew Perry and the Ketamine Queen
programme.desc: Amber Haque explores the relationship between the Friends actor and Los Angeles-based drug dealer and dual US-UK citizen Jasveen Sangha - dubbed the Ketamine Queen by US prosecutors - who was one of five people charged in connection with Perrys untimely death, including two doctors and Perrys personal assistant. She pleaded guilty to five federal counts, including one of distributing ketamine resulting in death

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the Slaters prepare for Freddie and Annas goodbye celebrations, relations are fraught between Jean and the family. Howie makes a life-changing decision, Lauren moots the idea of having Jimmy christened, and Harry takes Nicolas credit card on false pretences to buy drugs

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe has some difficult questions for a loved one, Anthony confronts Howie about his suspicions, Nicola tries to protect Harry, and Anna makes it her mission to build bridges between Kojo, Gina and Harry before she leaves

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Anthony and Howie are desperate to both keep their secrets as Kim plans her engagement party. However, as loose lips cause big trouble, the event doesnt go to plan. Lilys concern for Jeans mental health intensifies as she struggles in the wake of Freddies departure, and Nigel commences auditions for his film

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Christmas in Saint Marie is interrupted by the murder of a true crime podcaster on the hunt for a missing child, an investigation that turns out to be linked to an old case of the Commissioners. Things take a spooky turn when Marlon is forced to spend the night in a haunted house. Away from work, Darlene takes a hard look at her life choices and after a chance encounter in an airport car park, could love finally be in the air for Neville Parker? Ralf Little, Ginny Holder and Don Warrington star in this feature-length festive special, with guest appearances from Les Dennis and Siobhan McSweeney (Derry Girls)

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Doting mother Agnes resolves to have a proper family Christmas to celebrate son Trevor taking a break from missionary work for the first time in years. But Dermot is under pressure to spend the holiday with his posh in-laws, neighbour Winnie needs help finding a job, Buster has problems delivering the turkey, and to top it all off, there is no sign of any snow. Written by and starring Brendan OCarroll

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Agnes faces her busiest yuletide ever, with Trevor visiting from the missions, grandson Bono sleeping over on Christmas Eve and three new mouths to feed now that Dermot is the proud father of triplets. If that wasnt enough to juggle, she decides to take on the task of staging a nativity play at the community centre. Meanwhile, Buster and Dermot compete to play Santa in the Grotto, while Dino waits to see whether Rory will take him to the hairdressing award ceremony. Brendan OCarroll stars. Festive special from 2012

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Having cast herself in the role of the Virgin Mary and with rehearsals in full swing, Agnes vows to make her retelling of the Nativity at the community centre unforgettable. However, Father Damien has yet to approve the script and seems set on offering the role of narrator to Hillary Nicholson - and the doting matriarch has her patience severely tested when her friends and family keep badgering he for the best parts. Festive edition of the comedy first aired in 2012, written by and starring Brendan OCarroll

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren and Zoes friendship deepens as they discuss the latters long-lost son, but later, as they head back to Laurens place, someone is watching them from the shadows. George makes an effort to forgive, and Billy is given a mission by Lexi

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm surprises Gemma and Sadie with a weekend away. Returning home from living in Spain, Malcolms estranged father Jackie invites himself along. Worn down by his fathers constant jibes and Gemmas disappointment at the holiday, Malcolm calls Derek for help. Between managing Dereks secret addiction and Jackie trying to recruit investors to his business, Malcolm enters the talent contest. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.sub-title: Its What She Would Have Wanted
programme.desc: Short comedy film written by and starring Holly Hall, winner of the BBC New Comedy Digital Award 2021. Featuring Kate Robbins and Fiona Allen

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: South Africa has for years battled the scourge of rhino poaching, fuelled by insatiable demand for their horns in Asia. Ashley embarks on a mission to find out who is behind these acts, discovering how the challenges young men face growing up in deprived rural communities can lead them into poaching

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A tour of the worlds greatest landmarks, revealing how long it takes to build a pyramid, the controversy over the Statue of Liberty, and the pineapples of St Pauls

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A look at some of historys most ridiculous rules, from William the Conqueror chopping off body parts to Elizabeth I in court over some swan-related mischief

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield
programme.desc: Documentary following the midfielder as he takes up a management role at the club he helped create from the ground up

programme.title: Matthew Perry and the Ketamine Queen
programme.desc: Amber Haque explores the relationship between the Friends actor and Los Angeles-based drug dealer and dual US-UK citizen Jasveen Sangha - dubbed the Ketamine Queen by US prosecutors - who was one of five people charged in connection with Perrys untimely death, including two doctors and Perrys personal assistant. She pleaded guilty to five federal counts, including one of distributing ketamine resulting in death

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - The Cradle of Life

programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Theo, River, Arthur, Reece, Luna and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has got a blue bib and blue sunglasses inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different blue toys and objects in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate blue object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The traditional nursery rhyme Little Boy Blue features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger dressing up in blue things, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring the colour blue too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory scarves and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lolas family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lolas friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? Theres a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are admiring everything Duggee has grown in his vegetable garden, especially his crop of giant carrots, when they hear a noise. They investigate and find the Rabbits busy preparing for the Carrot Solstice, the day when the sun is at its highest. On this day, they gather round Carrot Henge to celebrate the glory of this humble vegetable. Trouble is, the Rabbits need to go and get ready - but who will look after the carrots? The Squirrels volunteer, so off the Rabbits go. Looking after the carrots seems easy at first, and Norrie arranges tasks for everyone. Betty skillfully organises the queue while Roly is on toilet duty. And then, disaster strikes. Worm pops up and eats part of Carrot Henge. Duggee is dispatched to fetch one of his own giant carrots to fill the gap. As time ticks on with no Duggee in sight, the place gets busier, and the sun is nearly at the top. Will Duggee fix the Henge in time, or will Carrot Solstice be ruined?

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam joins Coach at night school to get his diploma - and soon arouses Dianes suspicions when he begins to do unusually well. Comedy, with Ted Danson and Nicholas Colasanto

programme.title: Cheers

programme.desc: Ray becomes the butt of embarrassing jibes for failing to consider Debras feelings in a social crisis, and vows to be more attentive in future. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray gets the chance to cover the Super Bowl for his newspaper - but feels guilty about not asking Debra to accompany him. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A recurring dream makes Frasier wonder whether he is gay, prompting him to search for an explanation of its meaning - with a little help from Niles. Comedy, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. Comedy, guest starring Robert Prosky (Hill Street Blues), with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by Chris McCausland, Ben Miller, Nigel Havers, and Chris and Rosie Ramsey. With music from Jack Savoretti

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A radiation leak at the nuclear plant causes snow to fall, just in time for Christmas - and when Springfield is inundated with festive holiday-makers, Marge sees a chance to make some extra cash by opening up the family home to boarders. Meanwhile, Lisa decides its the thought that counts when buying this years gifts - much to the annoyance of Bart

programme.title: Mogs Christmas
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Judith Kerrs childrens book featuring the mischievous feline. When Mr Thomas brings home an enormous Christmas tree, Mog takes fright and scrambles onto the roof for safety. Regardless of the Thomas familys attempts to rescue her, Mog refuses to come down. Despite everyones fears, Mog has a magical night in the snow with a cat-themed Christmas dream. But will she arrive back home in time to join the family for Christmas Day? Narrated by Adjoa Andoh, and featuring the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch, Claire Foy, and Kerrs daughter Tacy Kneale as Mog, with an original song performed by Sophie Ellis-Bextor

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Raymond Briggs festive favourite, a wordless animated fantasy telling the story of a small boy whose snowman magically comes to life and whisks him off on the journey of a lifetime to the North Pole. Howard Blakes score includes the award-winning song Walking in the Air, which was taken to number five in the charts by a young Aled Jones, but is here sung by Peter Auty

programme.title: Father Christmas
programme.desc: Festive animation based on the book by Raymond Briggs, focusing on Santas leisurely life on the other 364 days of the year, before he sets off for his annual gift-giving sleigh ride. With the voice of Mel Smith

programme.title: The Snowman and the Snowdog
programme.desc: Animated sequel to Raymond Briggs classic festive tale The Snowman, telling the story of another youngsters magical Christmas. A boys snowman and snowdog come to life at the stroke of midnight and take him on an adventure to the North Pole, where he and his new companions meet an assortment of colourful characters, including Santa himself, before returning home - where a wonderful surprise awaits

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the 24th and final round of the season, held at Yas Marina Circuit. Lando Norris of McLaren was the victorious driver here last year, with the Ferrari duo of Carlos Sainz Jr and Charles Leclerc finishing second and third respectively. With analysis from David Coulthard, Mark Webber and Billy Monger

programme.title: Game of Wool: Britains Best Knitter
programme.desc: Tom Daley presents the quarter-final of the knitting challenge, with judges Di Gilpin and Shelia Greenwell. In the solo challenge, the knitters make bold, eye-catching jewellery, and in the team challenge, they create delicate lace for a lighting feature. But when the switch is flicked, any mistake will be glaringly obvious, so perfection is the only option

programme.title: Apollo 1: Destination Moon
programme.desc: The story of three astronauts who were selected as the first crew selected to fly an Apollo mission to the moon. But their prototype Saturn 1B spacecraft was riddled with design and manufacturing issues - a disaster waiting to happen. The events that followed shook the US space programme to the core and left a lasting impact on all space flights ever since

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Strictly Come Dancing, Changing Ends, One Shot with Ed Sheeran, All Her Fault, The Marvellous Miniature Workshop, Bullseye, Sara Davies Christmas Craft Off and the BBC News coverage of the Budget

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of Britains best-loved personalities turn their hand to being the countrys most opinionated viewers in this look back over the standout moments from series six. Programmes under consideration include Bridgerton, MILF Manor, George Clarkes Amazing Spaces, In with a Shout, Americas Sweethearts: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders, The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe, and coverage of the Glastonbury Festival and Donald Trumps victory in the 2024 US presidential election

programme.title: The Card Counter
programme.desc: A gambler and former servicemans spartan existence on the casino trail is shattered when he is approached by a vulnerable and angry young man, who is seeking help to execute his plan for revenge on a retired military Major - a mutual enemy from their past. Paul Schraders crime thriller, starring Oscar Isaac, Tiffany Haddish, Tye Sheridan and Willem Dafoe

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Memorable staff and patient stories at Kings College Hospital and St Georges in south London. Seventy-nine-year-old Carole is rushed to AandE with signs of a stroke. Shes confused and undergoes tests and a CT scan so doctors can assess how best to treat her. Ten-year-old Aiden comes to paediatrics with his mum Angel after hurting his foot at school and part-time wrestlers Kieran and James come in after Kieran injures his knee in a bout

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chefs attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around

programme.title: Kirsties Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps a couple Christine and Chris furnish their tenement flat in Glasgow and has a job on her hands trying to rein in graphic designer Chris, who has some out-there ideas. Plus, mother-of-two Helen Wade has moved back to the UK after spending the last 14 years in France, and wants to turn her bedroom into not only a sanctuary for herself, but also use it as a workspace

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It

Graham loves living in Windsor but Nardeth is growing tired of their cramped and dated house, and would prefer to look for a new property they could purchase

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie gets stranded in the snow during a shopping trip, and Doug soon outstays his welcome when he dispenses relationship advice to a couple offering him shelter. American comedy, starring Kevin James and Leah Remini

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Spence pretends to be Doug at a work baseball event held at Shea Stadium, and a dinner-party guest turns the tables on Arthur. Lou Ferrigno, alias the Hulk, guest stars as himself

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.desc: Ray is horrified to learn that his mother used to read the diary he kept as a teenager, which contained his most personal thoughts. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Lilith and Frasier are forced to spend time together while trying to convince the headmaster of an exclusive Boston school that their precocious son Frederick would be the ideal pupil. Comedy, guest starring Bebe Neuwirth

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson jets off to Spains Balearic Islands to help Liz and Tony, who first visited Majorca almost 40 years ago. Now that they are both retired, they would love to find their very own holiday home to escape the British winters and explore more of the islands beautiful scenery. Jean lines up five properties within their £190,000 budget, hoping that one will make them sign on the dotted line

programme.title: Kirsties Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Four of the countrys top knitters prepare to unveil their handmade knits. First, however, they need to compete against the clock, and each other, in the timed challenge. Plus, the host shows how to reuse ribbons to make terrific table place names and steps back in time to revisit a paper crafter with a passion for flowers

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: Its the last week of the competition and after the final four get to see the prize BandB for the first time, the first couple move into it for 24 hours to host some very important guests. Meanwhile, the other three couples are out and about in the region gathering vital inspiration for a business plan to help secure their future in France

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Fiona and Andy find the perfect holiday home that their children, grandchild and parents can all enjoy, along the shores of Almería around the sun-kissed town of Mojácar. Being a hill town and a vibrant and lively beach resort, Mojácar offers the best of both worlds. Jasmine shows Fiona and Andy what their budget of £210,000 can buy, from a spacious apartment with spectacular sea views to a beachfront bolthole with four pools

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: When 15-year-old Callum collapsed without warning in January 2025, doctors discovered a brain tumour. Now Callum is fighting to recover, but his future is still painfully uncertain

programme.title: Jamies Cook-Ahead Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents a two-part guide to getting Christmas organised ahead of time. The first episode features versatile gravy that starts life totally vegan and gluten free so that its ready for whoever is coming for dinner. Continuing with maximum flexibility, Jamie shares a get-ahead stuffing that can be meat or vegetarian, frozen ahead of time so that its ready to be unwrapped for the festivities

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: A Family Vendetta
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part special. Police receive a 999 call to an address in the quiet Cambridgeshire village of Bluntisham after a man has been fatally shot. Within minutes, a new emergency call is received for another shooting in another village just a 10-minute drive away. The new victim is the father of the first man found dead. Detectives establish that the motive for the double murder could lie in a dispute over who should have custody of the child of the first victim

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan launches the nightly update for Stand Up to Cancer 2025s week of fundraising action. Expect headline-grabbing celebrity stunts, powerful stories already grabbing the headlines and a look at whats still to come

programme.title: Say Nothing
programme.desc: Brendan unearths a mole in the IRAs ranks. Drama set in Northern Ireland during the Troubles, based on the book by Patrick Radden Keefe and starring Lola Petticrew and Hazel Doupe

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Penny is in anaphylactic shock after a wasp sting and Warwickshire, Northamptonshire, Derbyshire, Leicestershire and Rutland air ambulance crews are on their way. The Essex and Herts air ambulance look after teenager Connor, who has broken his leg while doing tricks on his bike. Plus, motocross rider Carl needs Thames Valley air ambulances help after an accident leaves him with a dislocated hip

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The trauma team rush to 67-year-old Walter, who has sustained a life-threatening head injury after falling down a remote hillside while walking with his sister. In Aberdeen, 62-year-old Liz has been rushed to hospital with a serious chainsaw cut to her arm, while 52-year-old Philip has crashed his motorbike at high speed and is lying in the central reservation of the motorway

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues to help the lost owners of Iberville Cuisine, in the French Quarter of New Orleans. Will the staff have to walk out and implement their plan B?

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Sara Bittorf goes undercover among the workforce of restaurant chain Boston Market, where she is chief brand officer. Disguising herself as an out-of-work waitress trying to win the chance to open up her own eatery by taking part in a bogus reality TV show, she tries to revive the companys image by learning more about its staff

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: When 15-year-old Callum collapsed without warning in January 2025, doctors discovered a brain tumour. Now Callum is fighting to recover, but his future is still painfully uncertain

programme.title: Cancer Detectives: Finding the Cures
programme.desc: The work of Manchester-based professor Caroline Dive, who is developing innovative blood tests to detect cancer, well before its visible on a scan. She is looking for tiny fragments of cancer DNA in the blood, which is comparable to searching for a needle in a haystack. Her innovative tests will also give clues on how to treat cancer, and in some cases cure. Taking part in her clinical trials are mechanic Lee, a medical mystery as doctors cant find where his cancer started, and Damian, who hopes to discover if his recent skin cancer will come back so he can move on with family life

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help the Clayton-Fishers, who have fallen out of love with their home in Walthamstow, east London. programme.title: Twisted Sisters: Madness and Manslaughter
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary exploring one of the strangest cases in modern British history In May 2008, Swedish twin sisters Ursula and Sabina Eriksson travelled to England and caused carnage by running repeatedly into traffic on a busy stretch of the M6 in an apparent suicide pact. While Ursula was air lifted to hospital for emergency surgery, Sabina was arrested and held in custody, but an unnerving comment she made while in custody soon took on a dark dimension

programme.title: Twisted Sisters: Madness and Manslaughter
programme.desc: Concluding part of the documentary. Sabina Eriksson is released from custody and meets 54-year-old Glenn Hollinshead, who offers her a place to stay. The next day he is found stabbed to death in his home and Sabina goes on the run before jumping off a footbridge over the A50, but she is arrested and goes for trial. With testimony from those involved in the case, including the prosecution lawyer, as well as those who spent time with Sabina, this film follows the lead-up to her trial and hears from the victims brothers about the devastating impact it had on their family

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Amy finds she has romantic feelings for Pennys former boyfriend Zack, while Raj and Howard begin competing to prove which of them would make the better superhero. Comedy, guest starring Brian Thomas Smith

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys have fun at the expense of Pennys boyfriend Zack, but later try to make amends by enlisting his help with the New Years costume competition at the comic-book store. Comedy, starring Kaley Cuoco and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonards ingenious idea for a new smartphone app puts pressure on his friendship with Sheldon, who vies with him for control of the project. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tension mounts when the pals attend a weekend science conference. Howard becomes argumentative after Bernadette runs into a former boyfriend, and the fallout causes chaos with the hotel room arrangements. Rick Fox guest stars, with Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Family Dynamics and a Red Fiero
programme.desc: The prodigy studies his family for a psychology project. Thanksgiving dinner ends up in an argument when Georgie Sr is offered a job in Oklahoma. Comedy prequel to The Big Bang Theory, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Stunted Childhood and a Can of Fancy Mixed Nuts
programme.desc: When the young genius learns that people with stunted childhoods can turn into social outcasts, he tries to act like a stereotypical child. Meemaw and Dr Sturgis relationship is tested when she teaches him how to drive

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer suffers a bout of incontinence and has to wear a nappy, forcing Marge to ask eccentric boffin Professor Frink to help determine the cause of his condition. With the use of a dream machine, Frink breaks into Homers subconscious mind where a string of insecurities are exposed, including one involving his late mother

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Theres a death in Springfield, while Krustys confidence takes a beating after he appears on a TV comedy roast with Sarah Silverman and Jeff Ross, prompting him to retire from the business. Lisa becomes worried for Homers safety, so sets out to prevent him getting hurt

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldons mother comes to visit and woos the gang, but he cannot help feeling jealous of all the attention she is receiving - until a bout of illness lays him low, and he suddenly sees the benefits of having her around. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard has doubts about his feelings for Priya when he kisses a girl he meets in the comic-book store, while the rest of the friends play pranks on Sheldon in celebration of Halloween. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is hurt to discover Penny and Bernadette went shopping for bridesmaid dresses without her. She first turns to a reluctant Sheldon for comfort and later tries to drown her sorrows. Comedy, starring Mayim Bialik and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny endure an awkward night at the cinema, both insisting the outing is not a date. Meanwhile, a terrified Sheldon enlists his friends help when a bird flies into his apartment, but his behaviour soon leaves them exasperated. Comedy, starring Johnny Gale, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer stages a revolt against moves to give Springfield a new telephone dialling code, stirring up public indignation and splitting the town down the middle. Featuring the guest voices of the Who and Gary Coleman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa joins an environmental protection group and begins campaigning in a last-ditch attempt to prevent the citys oldest redwood tree being felled by a rich Texan. With the voice of Joshua Jackson

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Theresa risks her own safety to help a spiralling Mercedes, and a resident worries about what a scorned ex is capable of

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tires of being followed everywhere by a lovestruck Ralph and hurts his feelings by blurting out in public that she cannot stand him - prompting disgruntled local lawman Chief Wiggum to harass Homer in retaliation

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Hosts Noel Fielding and Alison Hammond invite Oti Mabuse, Gabby Logan, David ODoherty and Suzi Ruffell to put their baking skills to the test, under the watchful eyes of judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. The celebs take on an ice cream roll Signature challenge and a kids party favourite in the Technical, before creating their greatest fear in meringue form for the Showstopper

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Wild Isles, Rise and Fall, Challenge Anneka, Race Across the World, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer, This Morning and BBC News bulletins. From March 2023

programme.title: Dating Naked UK
programme.desc: Hopeful singletons shed their inhibitions at a private villa in Colombia in the hope of finding their soulmate. Reality dating show hosted by Rylan Clark

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Student Charles is a self-confessed idiot who says his love life is a disaster, so he hopes to find a partner by going naked. Lee, also a student, identifies as non-binary and pansexual and is open to dating all genders. She hopes to find someone who will accept her for who she is

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls night in making home-made jewellery. Guest starring Bob Newhart, with Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Rajs old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Charity worker Freddie, whos 27, is set up on a date with 22-year-old fashion buyer Rebecca, hoping that she will be the girl who will be able to get his unique sense of humour. Meanwhile, 36-year-old Army medic Lyn meets Steve, a 38-year-old ex-Army engineer, but the date takes an interesting turn when she reveals that she is pregnant. Elsewhere, 52-year-old Jazz singer Gina is set up with 57-year-old singer-songwriter Nik, and food buyer Cindy from Leeds goes on a date with sales representative Elan

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to attempt to row down the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. But theres a reason it has never been attempted before - it runs through a steep gorge which, according to legend, drops off the face of the planet

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team venture into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take them through a forest unchanged for millions of years. The region is so remote, it could conceal undiscovered natural wonders - and so it proves as the journey results in a surprise beyond their wildest dreams

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and an elite team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. They are on their way to meet experts who have discovered ancient cave art thought to be among the oldest on the planet. But they have also heard rumours that the mountain range contains further unmapped caves - and Steve wants to be the first to track them down, and whatever is hidden within

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: June, a science-loving little girl, and her mother spend hours playing with stuffed animals and other toys, fashioning a world of imagination connected to a fabulous theme park. When Junes mom is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness and has to go away for treatment, June finds a real version of her theme park. Animated family adventure, with the voices of Mila Kunis, Jennifer Garner and Kenan Thompson

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: A foppish royalist nobleman leads a double life as a Roundhead-baiting highwayman. However, after Cromwells final victory at the battle of Worcester, the dashing hero has to smuggle the son of Charles I to safety in France. Swashbuckling adventure, starring George Baker, Sylvia Syms, Marius Goring, John Le Mesurier and Patrick Troughton

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Fatherhood
programme.desc: A father brings up his baby girl as a single dad after the unexpected death of his wife who died a day after their daughters birth. Comedy drama, starring Kevin Hart and Alfre Woodard

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: A secret agent branded a traitor tries to clear his name, with the aid of a socially awkward inventor he had fired for only developing non-lethal gadgets. The scientists latest invention gets out of control and transforms the spy into a pigeon - giving him the perfect disguise to prove his innocence. Animated adventure, with the voices of Will Smith, Tom Holland and Karen Gillan

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: A Roman centurion seeks to restore his fathers honour by recovering the standard of a legion that disappeared. Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrians Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Violent Night
programme.desc: Santa Claus materialises down the chimney of greedy matriarch Gertrude Lightstone just as criminal mastermind Mr Scrooge storms the mansion on Christmas Eve with an army of goons to steal 300million US dollars from the Lightstone family vault. Action comedy, starring David Harbour, John Leguizamo, Beverly DAngelo and Alex Hassell

programme.title: The 355
programme.desc: When a top-secret weapon falls into mercenary hands, a wildcard CIA agent joins forces with three international agents on a lethal mission to retrieve it, while staying a step ahead of a mysterious woman who is tracking their every move. Action thriller, starring Jessica Chastain, Penelope Cruz, Diane Kruger and Lupita Nyongo

programme.title: Can You Ever Forgive Me?
programme.desc: While suffering financial troubles, writer Lee Israel starts forging and selling letters by dead celebrities, incorporating intimate details to command high prices. She also starts stealing authentic letters from libraries and archives to sell, replacing them with forged duplicates. Comedy, starring Oscar nominees Melissa McCarthy and Richard E Grant

programme.title: Lumotv: Deaf Jams: Movement And Access
programme.desc: Dancer and actress Raffie Julien becomes the mentor she never had and podcasters Sarah and Kirsty Jade hit a legendary UK nightclub on a game-changing mission

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, starring Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: An aircraft manufacturer risks alienating his friends and family in a single-minded attempt to prove planes can exceed the speed of sound. David Leans drama, written by Terence Rattigan and starring Ralph Richardson, Ann Todd, Nigel Patrick, Dinah Sheridan and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime ministers formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: Unconventional submarine skipper Joe Glass is sent to investigate the torpedoing of US and Russian vessels. He winds up trying to rescue the Russian president, who has been kidnapped by a rogue general. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Gary Oldman and Common

programme.title: The Kings Man
programme.desc: Haunted by the death of his wife Emily, the Duke of Oxford is an ardent pacifist, who has established a network of servant spies coordinated by his housekeeper Polly to relay intelligence that will prevent conflicts around the world. When a shadowy mastermind known as the Shepherd orders the assassination of the Archduke Ferdinand, the Duke rallies his troops including right-hand-man Shola and his headstrong 17-year-old son Conrad. Action adventure prequel, starring Ralph Fiennes, Gemma Arterton, Rhys Ifans and Harris Dickinson

programme.title: Old
programme.desc: A vacationing family discovers that the secluded beach where theyre relaxing for a few hours is somehow causing them to age rapidly, reducing their entire lives into a single day. M Night Shyamalans horror, starring Gael Garcia Bernal, Vicky Krieps and Rufus Sewell

programme.title: The Missionary
programme.desc: A naive clergyman suffers various unfortunate temptations while trying to raise funds for an East End mission for fallen women. Comedy, starring Michael Palin, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliott and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Good News on GREAT!
programme.desc: An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter takes the lone survivor of a massacred party of settlers to an oasis, where he finds several other homesteaders and a military force have also sought shelter. They come under siege by a war party of Apaches, and face a struggle for survival - but an impending storm inspires a daring escape plan. Western, starring Rory Calhoun and Barbara Bates

programme.title: This Week Back Then

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: A spy for the Confederacy during the American Civil War decides to make a fresh start after the conflict, and takes a job working for a railroad freight company. However, his past catches up with him in the form of a former ally who is now the leader of a gang of bandits and is plotting a train robbery. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Claire Trevor and Joan Weldon

programme.title: Clash of the Santas
programme.desc: Robson Green and Mark Benton reprise their roles as feuding brothers-in-law Colin and Howie, from Christmas Lights, Northern Lights and City Lights, in a festive special. The pair travel to Lithuania, where Christmas cynic Howie has been nominated to represent England in the annual Santa competition, much to the annoyance of Colin, who believes his love of all things festive and his appearances in the white beard at the school fair make him the ideal candidate. However, he has to settle for being his friends little elf - and to make matters worse, the other elves are a bunch of cheerleading girls. So with a Saint Nick who refuses to believe and an elf who wants the top job, it seems their chances of winning are slight. Comedy drama, co-starring Nicola Stephenson, Sian Reeves, Ian Puleston-Davies, Edward Petherbridge and Emma Cunniffe

programme.title: Its a Wonderful Life
programme.desc: A hard-working, small-town businessman comes to think his life has been a complete waste of time and tries to commit suicide. Fantasy drama, starring James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Henry Travers, Beulah Bondi, Thomas Mitchell and Frank Faylen

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Berties circumstances change suddenly, leaving Edith uncertain whether to risk telling him the truth or keep her past a secret at all costs. Mary wonders if she can ever make peace with her sister as hostilities escalate, Spratt shows some hidden talents and Molesleys first day as a teacher does not go according to plan. Mrs Patmores bed and breakfast attracts unwanted attention, leaving her in need of the Crawleys help

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The last small-screen episode, catching up with the Abbeys residents at the tail-end of 1925. Mary endeavours to build bridges, but Ediths secret continues to pose a threat. As Henry settles into the role of husband, scars left by Charlies death are slow to heal, while Carson struggles to come to terms with developments that prove even he is not invulnerable to change. Spratts moonlighting venture is threatened by the conniving of Denker, and Daisy may have missed her chance with an admirer. Isobel receives devastating news, while the day that Anna and Bates have long-since waited for arrives

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective investigates the disappearance of a Dutch au pair, which seems connected to rivalry amid the citys academics. His search leads him to a family estate in the Oxfordshire countryside where he meets three siblings divided by personal demons and shared loss. Endeavour suspects there is a link between the disappearance and an unsolved case from years before, but as the investigation continues, conflict erupts between his fellow officers. When a group of teenagers makes a horrifying discovery, he suspects someone is manipulating events from afar

Mystery, starring John Nettles and Daniel Casey, with Charles Collingwood, Ann Bell and Miles Richardson

Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley and Julie Graham

programme.desc: Winter and Barnaby investigate when Lower Pamplings star cricketer Leo Henderson is found dead after a match in the grounds, pummelled to death by cricket balls. Barnaby is surprised to see DS Jones undercover as one of Leos team-mates, and his former colleague reveals he is working on suspected cases of match-fixing in the area, but things take an even more sinister turn when captain Fitz Theara is stabbed through the heart with a cricket stump

programme.desc: The Aidensfield police are puzzled when it seems a face from the past has become the unlikely victim of vandalism, and suspicions are soon aroused over the reasons for his sudden return to the village. programme.desc: Merton faces a race against time to stop a saboteur when Aidensfield hosts a prestigious car hill-climb. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk, Helen Baxendale and Navin Chowdhry

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A tax inspector goes missing as he tries to track down the maker of an illicit, potent cider popular among the residents of Midsomer Abbas. Pathologist Kate Wilding says the victims injuries look as if he was shaken to death by a giant, and as their inquiries continue, they discover the area is steeped in bizarre local traditions. programme.title: The Emergency Ward
