programme.title: Historys Greatest Aircraft
programme.desc: The McDonnell Douglas F-15 Eagle, an aircraft that immediately turned the tide of the first Gulf War in 1990. An immaculately restored MiG Killer was involved in one of the most bizarre combat incidents during that conflict, and has survived to tell the tale

programme.title: Historys Greatest Aircraft
programme.desc: The background and development of one of the Second World Wars most iconic bombers. The Boeing B-17 - known as the Flying Fortress - served with both the USAAF and the RAF

programme.title: Historys Greatest Aircraft
programme.desc: The B-25, which was often called the forgotten bomber. This mighty North American twin delivered the first blow in the fight back against Japan, in one of the most daring and audacious raids of all time over Tokyo in 1942

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Actor Laurence Fishburne explores how a perfectly masterminded plot led to one of the most brazen prison breaks in American history. With only a handful of clues left behind, the search for the infamous Alcatraz escapees continues to this day

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In February 1942, less than three months after the Japanese bombed Pearl Harbor, military radar picked up what appeared to be enemy aircraft over Los Angeles. Actor Laurence Fishburne recounts the battle of Los Angeles, contemplating whether the perceived attack, which threw the city into panic, was a balloon, UFO, or a more sinister plot

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Actor Laurence Fishburne explores Machu Picchu, one of the most puzzling archaeological sites on Earth. Its among the ancient worlds most enduring riddles - who built this astonishing complex, and why?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Actor Laurence Fishburne explores the death of Egypts iconic ruler, King Tutankhamun, whose demise continues to intrigue scholars and historians even after 3,300 years. Despite centuries of speculation and investigation, the circumstances surrounding King Tuts death remain shrouded in mystery

programme.title: Dragging Up the Past: Elizabeth I - The Rainbow Portrait
programme.desc: A journey through Tudor glamour and power, recreating Elizabeth Is iconic Rainbow Portrait. This documentary explores how the ageing queen used fashion as her fiercest political weapon. With a mix of camp wit, sharp historical insight and a runway-worthy reveal, Jack Dradeys short film proves that history can be as entertaining as it is enlightening

programme.title: The Other 300: Army of Lovers
programme.desc: Elite Greek army the Sacred Band, which was formed by the city of Thebes in 379BCE to defend itself from Sparta. Fighting for four decades undefeated, the army was annihilated by the forces of Philip II of Macedon and his son Alexander in the Battle of Chaeronea. Buried on the battlefield where they fell, the 300 were forgotten by history until a 19th century excavation uncovered their mass grave. However, the discovery was never published, and the evidence was lost. This documentary brings their story to light

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Unexplained phenomenon in Britain, from Stonehenge to crop circles and UFO sightings - including the famous Rendlesham Forest incident

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists speculate about metal artifacts that could provide physical evidence of extraterrestrials visiting Earth in the distant past. In Jacksonville, Florida, a strange metallic sphere falls from the sky, while an ancient aluminum wedge also baffles historians as to its source

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Quaint mansion RAF Rudloe Manor in Wiltshire, a suspected epicentre of British research into UFOs since the Second World War

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.sub-title: Best Of: Aliens and Human Evolution
programme.desc: The controversial theory that extraterrestrials have visited Earth for millions of years, exploring the notion that their intervention has played a role in human evolution. programme.title: What on Earth?

programme.title: Troy Story
programme.desc: Part one of two. The legend of the Trojan War, a conflict between the ancient Greeks and the city of Troy, sparked by the abduction of Helen of Sparta by the Trojan prince Paris. In 1874, Heinrich Schliemann announced he had found Troy, setting in motion a golden age of archaeology where a lost Bronze Age world was also rediscovered. Since then, many archaeologists have challenged his claims, but in every generation new findings have kept the search for the city alive. This documentary brings the search up to date drawing upon 21st-century science and archaeology to pinpoint its location

programme.title: Hazardous History with Henry Winkler
programme.desc: The modern concept of extreme sports is a product of marketing, but in the past a lack of rules made them truly dangerous. The actor highlights some examples, from bone-crushing football and deadly baseball games to wild events like auto polo

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.sub-title: Stirling - First War of Scottish Independence
programme.desc: US YouTube sensation Beau Ouimette, a river detectorist with over 30 years experience, pairs up with presenter and keen swimmer Rick Edwards, to search the UKs waterways in search of archaeological finds. In the opening episode, the pair tackle the River Forth in the shadow of Stirling Castle. In the first archaeological river search of this spot, they set out on the hunt for relics of Scotlands greatest medieval warriors, William Wallace and Robert the Bruce, revealing secrets from the battle sites of their most famous victories against their hated English overlords

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.sub-title: Warwick - River Avon and War of Roses
programme.desc: Beau Ouimette and Rick Edwards visit River Avon beneath the medieval Warwick Castle. Teaming up with one the UKs few diving archeologists, Gary Bankhead, Rick and Beau discover an array of artefacts ranging from the time of the Wars of the Roses to the Victorian age in Warwick. Next, they head down the river to Tewkesbury to find a Second World War helmet and Victorian crockery

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.sub-title: English Civil War - Newark - River Trent
programme.desc: Beau Ouimette and Rick Edwards head to the vast River Trent, site of one of the greatest strongholds of the English Civil War - Newark Castle. In the first official search of the waterway, the duo search for lost Civil War relics that reveal the secrets of this brutal battleground. They start their search directly next to the castle and find evidence from the key advances in warfare at the time, which eventually helped lead to the Kings demise. They also discover musket balls among other lost items that help picture the harrowing life in this turbulent time

programme.desc: Andy creates an incentive programme when Robert challenges the staff to double their sales, and promises to tattoo a picture of their choosing on his buttocks if they meet the quota - which they do in only one day. Pam becomes friends with Angela, who is also pregnant

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grampa is press-ganged into babysitting Bart, Lisa and Maggie while Marge and Homer visit a rural retreat in a bid to save their ailing marriage

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Three Men and a Comic Book
programme.desc: Bart becomes convinced Milhouse and Martin are trying to steal a valuable comic book they all clubbed together to buy. As his paranoia escalates, the three enter into a dangerous confrontation that threatens to end their friendship. With the guest voice of Daniel Stern

programme.title: This Is Christmas
programme.desc: Romantic comedy set during the Christmas season, following Adam and Emma on their daily commute from the village of Langton to London, where they meet the same passengers every day. Starring Alfred Enoch, Kaya Scodelario, Joanna Scanlan and Timothy Spall

programme.title: Tom Davis: Underdog
programme.desc: Comedian Tom Davis performs stand-up in front of a live audience, covering topics such as leaving school with no qualifications and the difficult road to fatherhood

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Marty Funkhouser cashes in on an empty gesture made by Larry regarding his mentally ill sister, while Susies dinner-party invitation lands Jeff in trouble. Meanwhile, the hapless hero realises he has to break up with Loretta before she receives her biopsy results. Comedy, starring Seinfeld creator and producer Larry David

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Larry urges Loretta to see a doctor, hoping she will be advised to break up with him, while his attempt to do a favour for Leon backfires when he inadvertently reveals a secret. Meanwhile, Richard Lewiss new girlfriend is offended after a misunderstanding. Comedy, starring Larry David

programme.title: The Force: Manchester
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Greater Manchester Police, which is Englands second-largest force and is responsible for protecting 2.7 million people

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The Proactive unit tracks down a stolen car and chases after a disqualified driver. Action-packed documentary series

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The Proactive Squad from Thames Valley Police use unmarked cars with on-board video cameras to give an intriguing insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented, featuring footage of dangerous drivers on the overcrowded roads

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: The team goes in pursuit of militant group the Emancipators, when its members hold a live-stream kangaroo court to publicly execute city politicians

programme.title: Marú inár Measc
programme.desc: The case of 15-year-old Arlene Arkinson, who was last seen in August 1994 as she left her home in Castlederg, Co Tyrone to attend a disco in Bundoran. Her body has never been found, but over 20 years later it would be ruled at inquest that she was abducted and murdered by serial killer Robert Howard. Her relatives still search for her remains to this day

The team also constructs a sky rocket, two men settle a 25-year-old quarrel by duelling with sabres, and James uses modern technology to help a man on a first date

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sparks are flying in Royston, Hertfordshire, and not just amongst the bidders as the contents of a bin goes up in smoke, and a mystery object under tarp causes a cat-fight. Seans flying skills are put to the test and Nat and John take a gamble on a double unit - but will it pay off?

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer go fishing for crucian carp in Wiltshire, a notoriously elusive fish that is usually only sighted at either dusk or dawn. They spend the night in a deconsecrated church, where Paul shares a new song that he is working on, while Bob brings a new fishing chair to the river that Paul does not approve of

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fish for chub on the river Wye in Herefordshire, Bob making an unexpected arrival by rowing boat. They are joined on todays trip by Dr Anand Patel from the Centre for Mens Health for a discussion of medical matters, and spend the night in a converted dovecote in the idyllic grounds of a 700-year-old manor house

programme.title: The Boat That Guy Built
programme.desc: Motorcycle racer Guy Martin renovates a neglected narrowboat using inventions of the Industrial Revolution, beginning with building a blast furnace to cast an iron pot to boil water. He then visits the Wedgwood factory to learn how to create traditional mugs so he can enjoy a cup of tea

programme.title: The Boat That Guy Built
programme.desc: Motorcycle racer Guy Martin continues his renovation quest and makes a steam engine to try to get his narrowboats shower working. He also visits the factory of lavatory manufacturer Thomas Crapper, where he tests 19th-century toilet-flushing systems

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Comedian Romesh Ranganathan joins the team in the studio. Chris Harris races the £2.5million McLaren Speedtail against an RAF fighter jet, and Paddy McGuinness tries out a cheap but luxurious off-roader

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris are sent on a high-altitude mountain expedition across Peru in second-hand American cars. Plus, back at the track, Chris tests out the latest electric car from Porsche

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As auctioneer Sean Kelly and the team arrive in Gwent, Heavy D confuses the other bidders and himself. Meanwhile, Nat takes a gamble, but John is far from happy

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Leeds

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey by exploring the history behind some of Britains famous pies, a dish the duo have written a book about. They also find out who ate all the pies on the football pitch

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of takeaway food in Britain and discuss the various ways that it has evolved over the years. The culinary duo also rustle up some of their favourite dishes

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the beautiful and unique landscapes of the Lake District, beginning by meeting Cumbrians with different visions for the future of Englands biggest national park. He talks to members of a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrels, a traditional farmer who feels that his ancient way of life is on the point of extinction, and an 18-year-old student who runs a 1,500-acre farm

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the impact of humans on the Lake District, discovering that the high number of visitors to Scafell Pike is damaging Englands highest peak and stretching the resources of mountain rescue volunteers. He goes wild swimming in the crystal clear lake of Buttermere, before taking a look at the less-fortunate Derwent Water, one of the many lakes now clogged with invasive New Zealand pygmyweed

programme.title: Will and Ralf Should Know Better
programme.desc: Will Mellor and Ralf Little return to test their modern-day manhood again, in a mission to discover what aspects of modern life they are getting right but are more often getting wrong, by driving a tank blindfolded and competing in wheelchair basketball

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers find a suspicious compartment within the trailer of a truck returning to Texas, and a man hides over 300 cheap forms of medication about his person in Progreso

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: Guy Martin attempts to break the motorcycle land speed record, which currently stands at 376mph. He travels to Bonneville Salt Flats in Nevada, where he must learn to ride a unique jet-propelled bike which has two engines and requires a completely different driving technique to any vehicle he has previously encountered

programme.title: Our Guy in China
programme.desc: Guy Martin examines Chinas history of innovation, technological development and manufacturing, revealing the unseen side of Chinas outstanding achievements. His adventure starts in Chongqing where he works in a factory to build his own electric motorbike, tastes produce from a farm that fertilises its crops with human faeces and visits the Three Gorges Dam, home of the worlds biggest hydroelectric power station. In Shanghai, Guy ships his motorbike home to Grimsby before jumping on a high-speed train en route to Beijing

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man kidnapped and beaten by a Mexican drug cartel flees across the bridge into America. At Progreso International Bridge, a woman is caught hiding anti-anxiety pills in her bra

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers intercept an arsenal of weapons being smuggled into Mexico, a deadly consignment of Fentanyl is discovered in a freezer and agroup of Guatemalan immigrants is stranded at the bridges

programme.title: Cape Carnage: Killer Catch
programme.desc: Documentary series following a family who make a living from hand-line fishing in the waters of northern Australia. In a high-risk and high-reward world, the crew battle rough seas, sharks and crocodiles hoping to reel in a profit through prized Spanish mackerel, which can weigh in as much as 30 kilograms per fish. The family endure challenges at every turn until they reach their ultimate destination of Cape Carnage - here, in the wilderness of the Northern Territory of Australia, the fish are huge but the sharks are even bigger. The volatile waters are where money is made, but also where even the most experienced fisherman can be broken. With three generations on board, the crew must also navigate a pressure cooker of family rivalry, relationships, and raising two children on a boat in the middle of the Australian ocean.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team finds out if you can grab a reliable used car for less than £500, with the help of a tank assault course. Chris Harris lives the high life in Maseratis MC20 supercar, and Freddie Flintoff goes on the charge in the all-electric Rivian pick-up truck

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness celebrate 100 years of the BBC by tackling 1920s-style motorsport. Continuing the motorsport theme, Paddy also delves into the history of BMWs legendary M-cars and Chris gets to grips Fords new WRC racer. Plus, with electric cars becoming a more common sight on the roads, the team investigates the future of fuel

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create classic puddings and explore the history and traditions behind Britains favourite desserts. They also take part in the world black-pudding throwing competition in Lancashire

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef travels to the far west of Cornwall to meet a potter whose work captures the rugged beauty of her surroundings. Then to the far east, on the trail of the poet Charles Causley, who spent his life in the Cornish border town of Launceston. There, Rick meets another Cornish writer, Patrick Gale, who has written a book on Causleys life, and considers him this countrys greatest Second World War poet. Rick also whips up his favourite seabass dish

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef visits the fishing port of Boscastle and finds a seafood restaurant in a building which once housed rockets used to fire safety ropes out to sinking ships. A trip to Cornwalls only dedicated organic mushroom farm inspires him to cook a stir fry with lions mane mushrooms, which it is said can regrow neurons. Rick also discovers a reason so many Germans love Cornwall

programme.desc: A water shortage means that the maternity home is busier than ever and two old schoolmates are reunited, but Marion shuns Shirleys attempts at renewing their friendship until they are brought together later in an unexpected way. Elsewhere, Barbara makes a revolutionary suggestion to help Sister Mary Cynthia treat the bedsores of her patient Tommy Mills, whose wife Gert may be more in need of care than he is. Fred thinks about taking the next step in his relationship with Violet. Drama, guest starring Una Stubbs and David Ryall

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Freds daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?

programme.desc: The OAP couples family continue to battle their various problems. Gillian is devastated when Celia inadvertently reveals a huge personal secret her stepdaughter has been keeping ever since she was 15 - and her already troubled relationship with Alan deteriorates as he distances himself from her. Meanwhile, Lawrence finds his mum Carolines new relationship difficult to accept, making her girlfriend Kate feel awkward around the teenager. Sally Wainwrights light-hearted drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Anne Reid, Nicola Walker, Tony Gardner, Sarah Lancashire and Nina Sosanya

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of criminal Mark Johnson, who was killed in a fire at Londons Union club in 1996. The original investigation was hampered by silence among witnesses and associates, but with new information suggesting the blaze was a targeted arson attack, the detectives hope they will have more success. Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Freds daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter enjoys playing surrogate father to his missing brothers infant son, and the local Womens Institute calls for his help to save a lighthouse from closure. Meanwhile, pub landlord Ted tries to claim damages for being stabbed in the buttock with a rogue antler. Stephen Fry stars

programme.title: The Chelsea Detective
programme.desc: Celia Swanson, a resident at a luxury retirement home, dies in her room. Bruising on her arm indicates that she was held down and forcibly injected - indicating a murder

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The CO has a lot on his mind after a civilian gets caught in the crossfire during a training exercise, causing an embittered Mark to fly off the handle. Julie has a surprise for Tony and Jacko, but ends up learning a harsh lesson, while Karens son Kevin wonders if he might be gay

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A woman seeks treatment for her terrible snoring, while Julia promises to meet Liam and Ocean for lunch but ends up doing something else. Starring Diana Keen, Tim Matthews and Catherine Hamilton

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: An elderly lady becomes convinced she is on the brink of death, while Julia is in a terrible mood because of her argument with Liam

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The pressure is starting to get to Tom and hes almost tempted to hit the bottle. The hospital chaplain refuses to bless Kath and Terrys union since theyve both been married before and Sandy sees Seans true colours. Guest starring Frances Barber

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Despite being in shock after finally receiving a diagnosis of his illness, Jordan fights to maintain his grip on the department. Ruth asks Jay to be her date at a formal dinner, while trouble with Sharices childminder highlights Zoes problems as a working mum - not least to the girls grandmother

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Garfield jumps at the chance of taking part in an undercover operation which will mean spending a weekend at the races. Unfortunately, he doesnt have much time for a flutter as the jockey he is protecting from a crooked bookie proves more than a handful. Police drama, starring Huw Higginson and Samantha Robson

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Minty makes a devastating discovery in the Arches, while Roxy hits Jack with some brutal home truths. Meanwhile, Trina plays a wicked trick on Denise

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Manda is excited about her hot date with Minty, but he has bigger things on his mind; will he tell Garry the truth? Meanwhile, Syd gets a new and unexpected housemate

programme.title: Miss Fishers Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Phryne heads off for a quiet holiday at the seaside holiday town of Queenscliff, confident she will not be disturbed by an investigation. However, it is not long she and Jack discover buried treasure, tales of pirate ghosts - and murder. Australian crime drama, starring Essie Davis and Nathan Page

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Pauls desire to turn Glenbogle into a luxury retreat is severely tested when a very demanding Russian millionaire and his wife come to stay. Meanwhile, Ewan asks Donald for advice on ways to win Zoe back, but finds he may not be as interested in making amends as he thought. Highland drama, starring Lloyd Owen, Alexander Morton and Martin Compston

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A pair of rich fashion designers are too preoccupied to realise their childs nanny is not all she seems. When their worst nightmare comes true and their baby is abducted, it is up to Jim to track them down. John Nettles stars, with Sheila Ruskin and Duncan Preston

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Speckled Band
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret are packing for a holiday in Athens - but their preparations are delayed by an unhelpful electricity board representative, as well as an escaped snake. Starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie, with Clive Mantle

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: The challenge of DIY proves too much for Terry when June decides to keep up with the Joneses. Comedy, starring Terry Scott and June Whitfield

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible test pilot. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While presiding over a murder trial in which a lawyer is representing himself and his younger siblings, Deed rekindles his affair with the scheming Francesca Rochester, ignoring his pregnant daughters pleas for help in the process. Blind to whats happening around him, and resisting warnings from Jo, the judge eventually realises his mistress has been deceiving him and must hope he has not left it too late to come to the aid of Charlie and her unborn child. High Court drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jenny Seagrove and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of criminal Mark Johnson, who was killed in a fire at Londons Union club in 1996. The original investigation was hampered by silence among witnesses and associates, but with new information suggesting the blaze was a targeted arson attack, the detectives hope they will have more success. Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A recently released convict comes under suspicion when a warden at his parole hostel is murdered. However, when the cold case squad become involved, it transpires the former prisoner may have been the intended target rather than the perpetrator, and that this killing may be connected to previous unsolved crimes. Nigel Terry and Kerry Fox guest star

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: The policeman accompanies climbers on a hill trek, but they find themselves in trouble after ignoring his warnings. Robert Carlyle stars

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Speckled Band
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret are packing for a holiday in Athens - but their preparations are delayed by an unhelpful electricity board representative, as well as an escaped snake. Starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie, with Clive Mantle

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: The challenge of DIY proves too much for Terry when June decides to keep up with the Joneses. Comedy, starring Terry Scott and June Whitfield

programme.title: The Chelsea Detective
programme.desc: Jess secretly arranges to go undercover on a date with Freddie to catch him off-guard and discover whether he is after the inheritance money

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodneys Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivans comedy

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: As Mike and Alison head off to celebrate Christmas with Mikes parents, the ghosts are touched to discover that Alison has left a gift for each of them in the library, with strict instructions not to open them until the couple return. Touched by her generosity, the spectres are inspired to give her a special Christmas present in return - but with Alison due back in a matter of hours, can they pull off their ambitious plan in time?

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: The comedians host Christmas dinner, but someone steals the turkey and they must put their heads together to capture the thief. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Ronnie Barker. First broadcast in 1973

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Its Christmas, a time of goodwill and cheer, but Del and Rodney are so sick of Grandads cooking and TV circuses that they put on their glad rags and have a festive night out at the Monte Carlo Club. However, an argument over the best romantic technique makes the pair forget their intentions, and the objects of their affections are whisked away from under their noses. Festive edition of the comedy from 1981, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas proves a depressing time for Del-Boy as he tries to get over another failed romance, but he soon bounces back after finding a new lady friend. The problem is she also has a son. Christmas special from 1982, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodneys Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivans comedy

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: If They Could See Us Now
programme.desc: Five years after finally achieving their lifelong dream of becoming millionaires, the Trotter brothers jet off to Monte Carlo with their wives and little Damien - but another dodgy deal by Del sees them scarpering back home and straight to the bankruptcy court. As the despondent duo come to terms with losing their fortune, they receive shocking news about Uncle Albert. Christmas special from 2001

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del feels down on his luck after the council rejects his application for a home improvement grant, but his spirits are raised when he hears about a fancy-dress party across town. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield star as the wheeler-dealers in the first part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy. With Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Douglas Hodge and Angela Bruce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del buys a new manual to help him show Raquel more appreciation and give him the confidence to make positive decisions. Unfortunately, as a result of such upbeat thinking, the Trotters cash flow hits an all-time low and an angry punter is left baying for blood. The second part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason, Tessa Peake-Jones and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Raquel invites her estranged parents around for dinner, and Del-Boy is keen to make an impression - but a mix-up with the gravy boat puts a damper on proceedings. However, things soon take a turn for the better when Dels father-in-law finds an old watch among the Trotters junk, which he claims could net them a pretty packet at auction. But nothing can quite prepare them for the shock they have in store. The final part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans travel to Wales to spend Christmas with the Wests, but for Gavin and Stacey, parenthood continues to present them with several challenges, their baby now being 10. Smithy also continues to commit to his fatherly role, making the journey to Barry at weekends and every second Wednesday to see 12-year-old Neil the Baby. Nessa has adopted her own style of mothering, while Pam, Mick and Gwen have become the epitome of doting grandparents. On Christmas Eve, Dawn makes a shocking discovery about Pete that jeopardises their marriage - again - while a visit to the pub becomes an eye-opener in more ways than one. Festive edition from 2019. starring Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Another chance to see the one-off festive edition from 2009. Jim and Barbara have received a gift from their loving children - a large sum of cash to spend however they choose. Barbara has dreams of going abroad, having only been away once before - on honeymoon to Ormskirk - while Jim has his heart set on a satellite HD box. As tension mounts between the couple, a family discussion ensues. Starring Sue Johnston and Ricky Tomlinson, with Caroline Aherne and Craig Cash (who also co-wrote) alongside Jessica Hynes, Peter Martin and Ralf Little

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Christmas is just round the corner but Mrs Brown has a problem. No one knows what her grandson Bono wants for a present this year - and hes already posted his letter to Santa. Presumably theres a good reason why they cant simply ask him. Meanwhile, the foul-mouthed matriarch struggles to control her temper at the familys games night when none of the guests will play by her rules, but at least there shouldnt be any problems with the Christmas tree this year as shes having a special one delivered

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters go on a lads day out to Margate with their mates, but things do not go as expected when their bus blows up, leaving them stranded overnight in the seaside town. Finding a room in the hotel from hell, the brothers are only too happy to go out and sample the local nightlife - and thats when Del-Boy gets a blast from the past. Feature-length Christmas special from 1989, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg are saved from the boredom of a garden fete when they meet a tramp with a peculiar interest in donkeys. Christmas special from 1987

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A festive special of John Sullivans sitcom from 2006. Jed, Elgin and Bryan become convinced a mythical creature is stalking Winterdown Farm, and Llewellyn accuses the Boyces dog of seducing his pedigree collie. Meanwhile, Beth is set for a Christmas surprise and Tyler spreads a rumour that Mrs Cakeworthy is pregnant - a revelation that comes as quite a shock to her husband, as they have not been intimate for some time. Nigel Harrison and Paul Bown guest star

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville faces being left alone at Christmas as all his friends and neighbours make plans to go away. He is particularly dismayed to see Mavis planning a Christmas break with Madge, and terrified to learn that Mr Newbold is plotting an escape from Mrs Featherstones advances, and leaving Granville entirely at her mercy. To make matters worse, the wily shopkeeper has a consignment of dodgy Christmas crackers to sell and a distinct shortage of customers. David Jason stars in the special festive episode

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Grim tracks down criminal carol singers, and Fowler falls victim to the ruthless Gasforth Amateur Dramatics Society. Goody, meanwhile, discovers giving presents to colleagues is not guaranteed to create goodwill. Festive instalment of the comedy from 1995, starring Rowan Atkinson and David Haig

programme.title: Death on the Tyne
programme.desc: Comedy mystery following on from Murder on the Blackpool Express, focusing this time on an eventful and bloody overnight ferry trip from Newcastle to Amsterdam. During the turbulent journey, the passengers and crew begin to get bumped off one by one in grisly circumstances, and everyone seems to have a motive for murder. Johnny Vegas, Sian Gibson, Sheila Reid, Sue Johnston, Georgie Glen, James Fleet, Felicity Montagu and Doon Mackichan are among the all-star cast

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Pompous Captain Mainwaring proves he is a softie at heart by organising a turkey dinner as a Christmas treat for the struggling senior citizens of Walmington-on-Sea. Festive episode from 1974, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and John Laurie

programme.title: Dads Army: The Animations
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring drills his platoon in physical fitness and assembles a choir to entertain the troops

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: The doting mothers hectic house becomes a little more noisy when she finds herself lumbered with a new guest - a homeless parrot. To add to her problems, she is on a desperate mission to make sure grandson Bono doesnt get sent to the infamous local primary school, against his parents wishes. At least she has her New Years Eve party to look forward to - which seems to be going well, until her guests start dropping like flies. Will she be left to sing Auld Lang Syne all alone? Festive episode of the hit sitcom, starring Brendan OCarroll. First broadcast in 2013

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Festive edition of the comedy sketch show from 1996, with characters joining in the fun including the Suit You tailors, Ron Manager, Ted and Ralph, Competitive Dad, Colin Hunt, Rowley Birkin QC and Jesse. Meanwhile. Jazz Club puts a new spin on We Wish You a Merry Christmas. Starring Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Caroline Aherne, Mark Williams, John Thomson, Arabella Weir and Simon Day

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A police chase ends with a spectacular crash and five trapped teens in the wreckage

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The team races to save an injured woman trapped in a van crushed between two lorries

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Featuring a stand-off involving a man wielding a samurai sword in South Yorkshire

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: HART staff must treat one of their own after a freak accident involving a 4x4 leaves an off-duty medic with serious injuries

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A massive explosion demolishes a block of flats and the team is called in to help. HART are on standby as a man with a gun is involved in a standoff with police

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel diagnoses the joint condition osteochondritis dissecans in a hyperactive ridgeback named Loki, and discusses treatment options with his owners. Newfoundland Hugo is referred for his hip dysplasia, but Noel discovers issues with his elbow and knee joints, while Carol and Nigel bring their mischievous seven-month-old Havana kitten Zahra following a mysterious accident at home, which resulted in a broken leg

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: An energetic one-year-old bull terrier puppy called Apple comes into the surgery with an ankle problem, and Noel hopes a custom-made, 3D-printed implant may give this beloved pet a new lease of life. He also treats a two-year-old Siamese cat with a broken leg, shattered pelvis and suspected spinal injury after being hit by a van, while four-year-old collie cross Rosco is tested for hip dysplasia

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Anna and Stuart head to the home of a former soldier who has fallen down some stairs and has a potential spinal injury. Jo and Laura treat a teenage boy having a seizure at college

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: V and Ollie race to a rugby pitch to help a man who has had a seizure. Sam and Tom are called to the home of a three-year-old girl whos suffered an allergic reaction to yoghurt

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Teenager Nathan has two twisted teeth extracted, Bob has keyhole surgery for a groin hernia, and 96-year-old Peggy entertains the team while having a growth removed from her toe

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Jonathan has a camera put inside his lungs to find out if he has cancer. James needs a knee operation so he can play with his children again, and a growth is removed from Jans ear

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Two strong-willed first-time mothers give birth at Leeds General Infirmary. Alexandra is 25 and left her native Latvia in search of adventure. She believes her child is the missing piece in her life, even though the father is not around anymore. Surbhi is from a warrior Hindu caste and knows what she wants, while her husband will do anything to please her, especially as he feels responsible for a motorcycle accident that left his wife paralysed in one arm

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows two couples on a busy maternity ward in Leeds. Father-to-be William, who met his wife Belem online, shoots a video with a running commentary in Spanish for his family in Colombia, while Kerry has set aside 84 colour co-ordinated outfits for their new addition, explaining that if she isnt fully prepared for something she panics. However, when her babys heart rate drops in labour, its her partner Dan who starts to worry

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a 67-year-old with a lung condition who cant breathe. Plus, crews help a 53-year-old whos had several seizures

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Altered States
programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores how adoption is a big business in California, meeting agencies, facilitators and lawyers matching babies to parents, with the adoption process often costing as much as $50,000. He meets families that have spent vast sums on children they are unable to conceive themselves, and women preparing to give up their babies, hearing the stories of poverty, addiction and abuse that have inspired their decision. He also discovers how the adoption process is open to abuse, and reflects on what happens when a mother has a post-birth change of heart

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: For the semi-final, it is social media week. The cooks must level up basic biscuits into Insta-worthy desserts and create a street food menu that would wow on socials

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: When Jasmine finds a property that reminds her of her childhood house, she knows shes found her forever home - it just needs some help from Jonathan and Drew

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After her husbands unexpected death, a mother of two is left with a house they had planned on renovating together. Jonathan and Drew step in to help

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: A couple moved to be closer to an amazing Deaf and Hard of Hearing school programme for their daughter. They love the neighbourhood now, but their home needs a revamp

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Hopesay, Shropshire to meet ex-fireman Joe and his seven-year-old daughter Lucy. Joe lost his wife Jess suddenly in 2014, partway through renovating an old cottage into what they had hoped would be a dream family home. Now work has ground to a halt and Joe and his daughter are living in a tiny caravan in the garden. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team arrives to give them the home Jess had wanted for them, backed up by an army of local tradespeople

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team help Scott Jones, a 17-year-old disabled athlete in Cheltenham, who is eager to become more self-sufficient at home, with the challenge including added side and rear extensions, a wet room, access to an adapted kitchen and a state-of-the-art gym studio. Scott won gold at the 2013 IPC world championships and aims to develop his talents in order to participate at the 2020 Paralympics in Tokyo

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team heads to Birmingham to transform the family home of parents Charlotte and Chris, whose twins were born prematurely and have a condition known as global development delay. It has slowed down their progress of walking and talking, but they are further hindered by their cramped house. Nick Knowles and the team join forces with a host of volunteers from the local community to rebuild the familys life and give them a better future

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake Christmas Special 2025
programme.desc: The canine-loving reality star returns to Dogs Trust for a heart-warming holiday special featuring some familiar faces from previous series

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A six-month-old collie appears to have a developmental deformity where the bones in its elbows dont fit together, but after CT scans, Noel sees that the situation is even more complex. A Burmese mountain dog has a painful bulging disc, which Noel hopes to replace with a bespoke titanium spacer screw, while cat Elmo has a complex fracture to its left back leg after being hit by a car

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A French bulldog is brought in after collapsing and struggling to move, and after a full medical assessment, Noel realises an exploded disc in the dogs neck is pressuring its spine to such an extent it is slowly causing paralysis. The vet also treats an excitable Staffordshire bull terrier suffering from a problem where the bones in its elbows do not fit properly and a cat that has been shot with an airgun

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a woman whose foot was run over by a bin lorry, and a team is sent to assess a man suffering from an agonising headache that has been going on for days.

programme.title: Louis Theroux - The Most Hated Family in America
programme.desc: The journalist heads for Topeka, Kansas, to meet members of the controversial Westboro Baptist Church. Comprised almost entirely of members of the Phelps family, the organisation is vehement in its disapproval of homosexuality and followers have picketed the funerals of Iraq War soldiers in protest against Americas attitude toward gay people. Louis witnesses the emotional toll the clans strict rules have taken on its members, including 21-year-old Jael who says she will never have a boyfriend. He also meets Steve Drain, who set out to make a documentary about the group - and ended up as one of its number

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: The finalists level up childhood favourites and cater for a celebrity party attended by Michael Dapaah and AJ Tracey, with the help of the eliminated cooks

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Clovelly in Devon, looking at its transformation from fishing harbour to romantic Victorian seaside resort. Thanks to a powerful and pioneering woman, Clovelly found itself at the forefront of the holiday revolution, and even today cars are banned and the village is privately owned, helping to preserve it as a reminder of a bygone age

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals how some of the nations best-loved villages played a vital part in significant moments of history. He begins in Bamburgh in Northumberland, explaining how the health and fortunes of the village were shaped by those in charge of its famous castle, from early English kings to 18th-century philanthropists, who pioneered a welfare system nearly 200 years before one existed nationally. Ben visits fellow archaeologist Jessica Turner, whose findings show the seventh-century residents of Bamburgh were robust and healthy - contrary to the usual malnourishment of the British medieval population

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Thorpeness in Suffolk, the first purpose-built seaside village in the UK. The ingenuity of amenities such as the hand-dug lake, country club and inland housing were the unique vision of Glencairn Stuart Ogilvie. Hamish Ogilvie helps Ben to understand his great-grandfathers vision, stemming from theatrical inspiration

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits Alnmouth, Northumberland, which was founded in the mid-12th century after the barons of nearby Alnwick obtained a charter from King John to build a new village. It had a market and a small port and the village flourished - so much so that by the mid-1700s, Alnmouths grain export started to play an integral role in feeding the growing English population

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: The crew of Karen of Ladram hunts hake off Cornwall, but the trip is thrown into jeopardy when a crew members health deteriorates and their catch is decimated when seals get to the fish first. Elsewhere, a rookie crew works in the Irish Sea, trainee skipper Michael steps up in a storm, and Tydus heads out in search of crabs

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Adam takes a gamble and leaves the English Channel in the hope of finding Dover sole, one of the most expensive fish in British waters, to help cover his rising financial issues. Up in Scotland, Stephen breaks from the rest of the fleet for some solo fishing but heads towards some stormy weather, leaving him with a decision to make

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Storm Arwen hits the UK and the skippers have tough decisions to make. Boats start to roll in the North Sea, putting Victory Rose and Our Lass at risk of collision. Skipper Darren has just three days of crabbing time before the storm pushes the boat back to the harbour and George Jack considers venturing in to the storm in search of a new species of prawn

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek checks out an abandoned 1985 Renault 4 and an MGB Roadster that hasnt seen the light of day for 36 years, and Jack heads to Rotherham to pick up a pair of rare Bond Bugs.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: In the 100th episode, Derek heads to Northumberland to collect a rare 1975 NSU RO 80, Jack deals with a Mini Mayfair stuck in a barn, and an Aston Martin DBS husk is auctioned

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: On the way to pick up two lovely 70s Lotus sports cars, Derek takes to the skies for his first ever helicopter flight in a 1967 Bell 47 chopper

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will Trickett and Gus Gregory want to do a 4x4, but their dream list of cars is short on their budget. However, Will has a plan, and steers them towards a friends Suzuki SJ

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an insight into the most successful animals on the planet. Observing an Arctic fox stalk prey in its -20C environment, he reveals warm-bloodedness as one of the key factors in the mammals global domination. He also studies marsupials in Australia and Central America, offering a unique view inside a platypuss breeding burrow

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough offers an insight into insect-eating animals, including shrews that dive under water, moles that can swim in the Namib Desert, and New Zealand bats that hunt in packs on the ground, walking on their wrists and foraging. Plus, how hedgehogs and armadillos liven up their diet with fruit and birds eggs, while pangolins and giant anteaters survive entirely on a diet of insects

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses advanced surveillance technology to observe the feeding habits of herbivores, including elephants forced to undertake epic migrations to ensure a steady diet of the plants they need to survive. He also considers the habits of the sloth, which takes a month to digest each meal, and reveals scientific research suggesting that grazing wildebeest do not follow the rains as originally thought, but detect trails of phosphorus in the grass

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the world of rodents, whose constantly growing incisor teeth are used to chisel through any obstacle and range from squirrels and the English harvest mouse to the large South American capybara. He looks at examples of their dental prowess, showing how agoutis in Panama break open rock-hard nutshells and the skills employed by beavers in Wyoming as they fell massive trees to build dams rivalling feats of human engineering

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson Green explores an ancient trail along the stunning Jurassic Coast in Dorset, and comes face-to-skull with a giant Pliosaur, also known as a Sea-Rex

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will Trickett and Gus Gregory want to do a 4x4, but their dream list of cars is short on their budget. However, Will has a plan, and steers them towards a friends Suzuki SJ

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek brings a small army of military hardware to Thornton le Dale including a Studebaker Weasel tracked vehicle and a WWII-era Willys Jeep

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek auctions off a Jensen Interceptor and a Jensen Healey along with a one-off Wood and Pickett Triumph Dolomite Sprint. Sarah takes a shine to a four-tonne road roller

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1971 Mercedes SL and a 1989 Jaguar XJS emerge from a barn on a chicken farm, a Roller and a Rover go under the hammer and a 1966 Triumph Spitfire is restored to near perfection

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: In the early 19th century Staithes was as one of the largest east coast fishing ports, and even now the harbour building renovations reveal the seaside villages impressive financial boom. Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the harsh North Yorkshire coastline that surrounds Staithes, as he finds out how the village was built to be a safe haven. It was also a settlement rich in the natural resource of shale. Contributors include local author Peter Appleton and fellow archaeologist Caroline Barrie Smith

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson pays a visit to the beautifully preserved village of Arnside, sitting just outside the Lake District on the banks of the River Kent. Once serving the port of Milnthorpe, the village expanded with the arrival of ship carpenter John Crossfield, leading to its expansion in the early 1800s as part of the boat-building industry. Ben talks to Victorian industry expert Dr Stephen Caunce and meets a descendant of the Crossfields family, talking about the villages tourist success and architectural history

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Charlestown in Cornwall, revealing how the villagess namesake Charles Rashleigh transformed the local trade and commerce from fishing and distribution of pilchards, to minerals exported by a hand-built port with pioneering technology. Ben looks at how Charles commissioned renowned engineer John Smeaton to create man-made lakes and hand-dug ponds, and explores their impact on the villages prosperity

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson explores Parkgate on the estuary of the River Dee, Cheshire. The village is landlocked due to the estuarys shifting silt, but 250 years ago it was a bustling harbour

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce looks back at a selection of 2011s most memorable finds, including a Victorian brooch designed by William Burges that was previously believed to be lost. The piece was discovered by a viewer following an appeal on the programme - and went on to sell for far more than its estimated value at auction. She also explores the history of gift-giving at Christmas and learns about antique toys that are highly sought-after by collectors

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts examine valuables and rarities at Hartland Abbey in Devon. programme.desc: The adventurer embarks on a journey across the country, meeting a diverse array of people and encountering exotic wildlife. He begins in Northern Territory, where he discovers how the camel is threatening the fragile desert ecosystem, then heads through wine country to the South Australian city of Port Lincoln to dive with critically endangered southern blue fin tuna. In Western Australia, he joins a 21st-century gold rush and ends his first leg in state capital Perth, where he meets a former binman from Hull who now has a house in the sun, a private pool and his own boat

programme.title: Irelands Thalidomide Scandal
programme.desc: The thalidomide scandal in Ireland, which is considered one of the countrys longest-running medical tragedies. The flawed drug was used in the 1960s to treat morning sickness and as a sedative for pregnant women and teething infants. It was sold over the counter under various brand names, and was also available from general practitioners and in hospitals, surgeries and maternity homes. Unfortunately, it led to numerous children being born with a range of severe deformities

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Aiden Byrne has his eye on the prize as he puts four home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make a perfectly seasoned soup. Sheree Murphy hosts

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the grand final of the singing contest as the finalists are joined by three previous singers for one-of-a-kind duets as they compete to be crowned champion by judging panel Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama and special guest Danny Jones

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Sports Gone Wrong
programme.desc: From shocking meltdowns to all-out brawls, another dive into the most chaotic and unexpected moments in sports history

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Rupert Rowley puts four amateurs through a series of culinary tests, including how to make poached egg and asparagus, with the aim of choosing one to join him in the final

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of a regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: Melanie arrives at the research station where she makes some startling discoveries while struggling to survive and thinking back to the days before the Freeze. She strives to do what others before her could not. Drama, starring Jennifer Connelly, Daveed Diggs and Iddo Goldberg

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the game show as business strategist Mubeen, theatre technician Emma, and ambulance controller Paddy compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Comedian Alan Carr joins the host to discuss his recent projects, including his victory in Celebrity Traitors. Also appearing are Oscar-winner Kate Winslet, who discusses her role as first-time director of Christmas movie Goodbye June, former New Zealand politician Jacinda Ardern, whose documentary film Prime Minister tells the story of her five-year tenure at the top and US talk show host and podcaster Seth Meyers. Plus, Carrs fellow Traitor Cat Burns performs Theres Just Something About Her, from her album How to Be Human

programme.title: Saturday Knight Takeaway
programme.desc: A compilation of various sketches from Ant and Decs Saturday Night Takeaway TV show

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: After a sizzling first week in paradise, our All Stars know that - if anything - finding love can be even tougher second time around... but not one of them wants to leave that villa right now, so get ready for some serious grafting from our Love Island legends.

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: The temperature is rising and there are plenty more surprises in store because nothing is quite what it seems in paradise - every day is jam-packed with twists and turns to keep our legends on their toes.

programme.desc: Contestants from Portsmouth, Essex, Manchester, London and Derbyshire take on five rounds of fiendish puzzles as they attempt to qualify for the series Grand Final. Lucy Worsley asks the questions

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win £2,000

programme.title: Animal Emergency
programme.desc: Old English sheepdog puppy Jessie has narrowly avoided death but now must undergo emergency surgery. Elsewhere in the hospital, owner Alan is determined to give his 13-year-old crossbreed Jessica as comfortable life as possible as she battles terminal kidney disease. Coco the alsatian is examined to see if she is a candidate to become a blood donor ,while Mary the heifer is operated on to correct a problem with her leg

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Archive news stories from 2002, the year of Roy Keanes famous spat with Mick McCarthy, igniting a national debate that continues to this day. Bertie Ahern led Fianna Fail to victory in the general election but fell just short of an overall majority and a levy of 15 per cent was introduced on plastic bags

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Headline stories from 2003, accompanied by the music of the time

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: A cowboy-themed party appears to be the perfect opportunity for the men to let off some steam. But when thoughts turn to the final kiss-off, one couple find themselves in a stand-off as their future outside of the complex raises doubts. Dating show, hosted by Dannii Minogue

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Jodie Foster discusses her role in the latest season of TV drama True Detective: Night Country, Oscar-winner Olivia Colman talks about her new mystery comedy Wicked Little Letters, while US comedy great Wanda Sykes reflects on her Netflix special Im an Entertainer. Plus, doyenne of daytime TV Lorraine Kelly discusses her debut novel The Island Swimmer and Austin Butler and Josh Brolin discuss new sci-fi epic Dune: Part Two. Calvin Harris and RagnBone Man deliver a world exclusive performance of their new single Lovers in a Past Life

programme.title: My Wife, My Abuser
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary about the real-life experiences of Richard Spencer, who endured nearly two decades of coercive control and manipulation by his wife, Sheree. The film provides an unfiltered look into Richards life, showing how the abuse impacted his physical health, emotional well-being and sense of safety. Much of his experience is documented through hidden recordings, creating a powerful narrative of survival

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: The temperature in paradise is rising for our couples and our legends are having the time of their lives, but who will be coupling up and who is in danger of getting dumped? The stakes are getting higher by the day...

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: Its been another rollercoaster day in paradise for the All Stars as they learn that the path to finding true love isnt a smooth one second time around - with all of them determined to make it all the way to the final, whos really after romance and whos just looking for some fun in the sun?
